repnme.cdata!:
Guinea - Second Power Engineering and
            Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Second Power
            Engineering and Technical Assistance Project for Guinea was
            unsatisfactory. The project achieved its objectives, its
            impact on institutional development was modest,
            sustainability is uncertain, and the performance of the Bank
            was satisfactory while the Borrower's was
            unsatisfactory. Several lessons can be learned from this
            project. First, granting greater management responsibility
            in exchange for a performance-based approach to technical
            assistance could have offered better prospects. Second, in
            the future, GOG should only agree to measures which are
            within its capacity to execute and the Bank should be more
            circumspect in accepting such assurances at face value.
            Finally, IDA played a crucial role in bringing about
            fundamental sector reforms. Its support was a critical
            element that finally resulted in a turn around situation,
            which may not have otherwise been achieved.

repnme.cdata!:
Guinea - Second Power Engineering and
            Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Power Engineering and
            Technical Assistance Project will continue the efforts begun
            under the First Power Project to rehabilitate the existing
            facilities, organization and management of the power sector,
            Societe Nationale d'Electricite (SNE) and the Service
            National de l'Hydraulique (SNH). The major project
            components are: (a) an extension of ongoing training and
            technical assistance to SNE; (b) an organizational and
            institutional study of the power sector, a power planning
            study, a feasibility study and detailed enginnering of the
            first power plant recommended by the planning study, and a
            study for the rehabilitation and extension of the
            subtransmission and distribution systems; (c) spare parts,
            equipment and materials, and a warehouse for SNE; and (d)
            technical assistance, training and equipment to improve
            SNH's operations.
